qas.question: Who has the largest accredited diplomats in Bermuda?
Who is the current US Consul General?
Why is the US so important to Bermuda?

answers.text: The United States is Bermuda's largest trading partner

qas.question: What percentage of Bermuda's residents are US citizens?
What does Bermuda maintain in the United States?

plausible_answers.text: United States Consulate and the US Customs and Border Protection Services at the L.F. Wade International Airport.

qas.question: What is the Bermuda diplomatic mission comprised of?
When did Robert Wade take office?
What percentage do the 14% US citizen residents of Bermuda represent as foreign born persons?

context: There are few accredited diplomats in Bermuda. <a0_0>The United States<a0_0/> maintains the <b4_0>largest diplomatic mission<b4_0/> in Bermuda, comprising both the <b5_0>United States Consulate and the US Customs and Border Protection Services at the L.F. Wade International Airport.<b5_0/> The <b6_0>current US Consul General<b6_0/> is <a1_0>Robert Settje<a1_0/>, who took office in <b7_0>August 2012.<b7_0/> <a2_0>The United States is Bermuda's largest trading partner<a2_0/> (providing over 71% of total imports, 85% of tourist visitors, and an estimated $163 billion of US capital in the Bermuda insurance/re-insurance industry), and an estimated <a3_0><b8_0>5%<b8_0/><a3_0/> of Bermuda residents are US citizens, representing 14% of all foreign-born persons. The American diplomatic presence is an important element in the Bermuda political landscape.
